org.pepstock.charba.client

Class AbstractChart<O extends BaseOptions,D extends Dataset>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
        • org.pepstock.charba.client.AbstractChart<O,D>
  • Type Parameters:
    O - Options type for the specific chart
    D - Dataset type for the specific chart
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasVisibility, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, IsChart<O,D>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarChart, BubbleChart, DoughnutChart, GaugeChart, LineChart, MeterChart, PieChart, PolarAreaChart, RadarChart, ScatterChart, StackedAreaChart, StackedBarChart

    public abstract class AbstractChart<O extends BaseOptions,D extends Dataset>
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
implements IsChart<O,D>
    Base class of all charts.
    It contains Chart.js initialization.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractChart()
      Initializes HTMl elements (DIV and Canvas).
      It sets also some default behaviors (width in percentage) for resizing

      Calling on your chart instance passing an argument of an event, will return the single element at the event position.

      DatasetMetaItem getElementsAtEvent(ChartNativeEvent event)
      Looks for the element under the event point, then returns all elements at the same data index.
      Calling it on your chart instance passing an argument of an event, will return the point elements that are at that the same position of that event.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Use this to destroy any chart instances that are created. This will clean up any references stored to the chart object within Chart.js, along with any associated event listeners attached by Chart.js.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Use this to stop any current animation loop. This will pause the chart during any current animation frame. Call .render() to re-animate.
        See Also:
        render()

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Will clear the chart canvas. Used extensively internally between animation frames.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the chart to it's state before the initial animation. A new animation can then be triggered using update.

      • toBase64Image

        public java.lang.String toBase64Image()
        his returns a base 64 encoded string of the chart in it's current state.
        Returns:
        base 64 image or null if chart is not initialized

      • generateLegend

        public java.lang.String generateLegend()
        Returns an HTML string of a legend for that chart. The legend is generated from the legendCallback in the options.
        Returns:
        the HTML legend or null if chart is not initialized
        See Also:
        LegendCallback

      • resize

        public void resize()
        Use this to manually resize the canvas element. This is run each time the canvas container is resized, but can be called this method manually if you change the size of the canvas nodes container element.

      • update

        public void update()
        Triggers an update of the chart. This can be safely called after updating the data object. This will update all scales, legends, and then re-render the chart.

      • update

        public void update(UpdateConfiguration config)
        Triggers an update of the chart. This can be safely called after updating the data object. This will update all scales, legends, and then re-render the chart. A config object can be provided with additional configuration for the update process. This is useful when update is manually called inside an event handler and some different animation is desired.
        Parameters:
        config - A config object can be provided with additional configuration for the update process
        See Also:
        UpdateConfiguration

      • render

        public void render()
        Triggers a redraw of all chart elements. Note, this does not update elements for new data. Use .update() in that case.
        See Also:
        update()

      • render

        public void render(UpdateConfiguration config)
        Triggers a redraw of all chart elements. Note, this does not update elements for new data. Use .update() in that case. A config object can be provided with additional configuration for the render process. This is useful when update is manually called inside an event handler and some different animation is desired.
        Parameters:
        config - A config object can be provided with additional configuration for the render process
        See Also:
        update(), UpdateConfiguration

      • getDatasetMeta

        public DatasetMetaItem getDatasetMeta(int index)
        Looks for the dataset that matches the current index and returns that metadata.
        Parameters:
        index - dataset index
        Returns:
        dataset meta data item.

      • getDatasetAtEvent

        public DatasetMetaItem getDatasetAtEvent(ChartNativeEvent event)
        Looks for the dataset that matches the event and returns that metadata.
        Parameters:
        event - event of chart.
        Returns:
        dataset meta data item. FIXME to add to JSINTEROP impl

      • isDatasetVisible

        public boolean isDatasetVisible(int index)
        Looks for the dataset if it's visible or not, selected by index.
        Parameters:
        index - dataset index
        Returns:
        true if dataset is visible otherwise false. FIXME to add to JSINTEROP impl

      • getVisibleDatasetCount

        public int getVisibleDatasetCount()
        Returns the amount of datasets which are visible
        Returns:
        the amount of datasets which are visible. If chart is not initialized, return UndefinedValues.INTEGER. FIXME to add to JSINTEROP impl

      • getElementAtEvent

        public DatasetItem getElementAtEvent(ChartNativeEvent event)
        Calling on your chart instance passing an argument of an event, will return the single element at the event position.
        If there are multiple items within range, only the first is returned.
        Parameters:
        event - event of chart.
        Returns:
        single element at the event position or null.

      • getElementsAtEvent

        public DatasetMetaItem getElementsAtEvent(ChartNativeEvent event)
        Looks for the element under the event point, then returns all elements at the same data index.
        Calling it on your chart instance passing an argument of an event, will return the point elements that are at that the same position of that event.
        Parameters:
        event - event of chart.
        Returns:
        all elements at the same data index or an empty list.

      • draw

        public void draw()

      • toJSONString

        public java.lang.String toJSONString()
        Returns the chart configuration in JSON format.
        Returns:
        the chart configuration in JSON format.
